intro: Ditassa laevis, commonly known as the smooth ditassa, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and thrives in partial to full shade. Its flowers are often visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
